cpld¶

platform

Linux, Windows

synopsis

Python script to update CPLD unisgned capsule and sign it

cpld module includes function to sign cpld capsule using intel_pfr.sign module. The unsigned recovery capsule is the pfr_cfm1_auto.rpd generated from Quartus. Then use both RK and CSK private keys to sign it.

Sign CPLD recovery/staging capsule

Sign in python console and script¶

code block:

>>>from intel_pfr import cpld
>>>mycpld = cpld.CPLD(unsigned_cap, rk_prv, csk_prv, csk_id)
>>>mycpld.sign()

Sign in command line¶

python (or python3 for Linux) should be in system executable path. save the keys and unsigned capsule in work folder. It requires Python 3.6 or later Python

command line:

>python -m intel_pfr.cpld -h   # help
>python -m intel_pfr.cpld -u <unsigned_capsule> -rk <root private key> -csk <csk private key> -cskid <csk id, optional> -o <output, optional>

Functions

main(args)

sign cpld capsule in command line
class cpld.CPLD(unsigned_cap, rk_prv, csk_prv, csk_id=0)¶

Bases: object

class for cpld image operation

Parameters

  • unsigned_cap – unsigned cpld capsule name

  • rk_prv – root private key in PEM format

  • csk_prv – csk private key in PRM format

  • csk_id – CSK ID, default is 0

set_signed_cap(signed_cap_name)¶
sign_capsule()¶
cpld.main(args)¶

sign cpld capsule in command line
